## Dataset

```{r}
head(penguins)
#head(penguins_raw)
```

```{r eval=FALSE}
p <- penguins %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = flipper_length_mm,
              color = species)) +
    geom_point()

pngfile <- fs::path(knitr::fig_path(),  "scaling.png")
agg_png(pngfile, width = 60, height = 36, units = "cm", res = 300, scaling = 3)
plot(p)
invisible(dev.off())
knitr::include_graphics(pngfile)
```

## Colors

- set [colorblind-friendly palettes](https://jfly.uni-koeln.de/color/)

```{r}
# The palette with grey:
cbp1 <- c("#999999", "#E69F00", "#56B4E9", "#009E73",
          "#F0E442", "#0072B2", "#D55E00", "#CC79A7")

# The palette with black:
cbp2 <- c("#000000", "#E69F00", "#56B4E9", "#009E73",
          "#F0E442", "#0072B2", "#D55E00", "#CC79A7")
```

```{r}
ggplot <- function(...) ggplot2::ggplot(...) + 
  scale_color_manual(values = cbp1) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = cbp1) +
  theme_bw()
```

## Diagram types

### Point chart

```{r}
(
  p <- penguins %>%
    remove_missing() %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = flipper_length_mm,
              color = species)) +
    geom_point() +
    labs(subtitle="Area Vs Population", 
       y="Population", 
       x="Area", 
       title="Scatterplot", 
       caption = "Source: midwest")
)
```

- Jitter with smoothing line

```{r}
(
  p <- penguins %>%
    remove_missing() %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = flipper_length_mm,
              color = species)) +
    geom_jitter() +
    geom_smooth(method = "loess", se = TRUE) +
    facet_wrap(vars(species), nrow = 3)
)
```

```{r}
p <- penguins %>%
  remove_missing() %>%
  filter(species == "Adelie") %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = flipper_length_mm)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "loess", se = TRUE)

ggMarginal(p, type = "histogram", fill="transparent")
ggMarginal(p, type = "boxplot", fill="transparent")
```

### Bubble chart

```{r}
(
  p <- penguins %>%
    remove_missing() %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = flipper_length_mm,
              color = species, size = body_mass_g)) +
    geom_point(alpha = 0.5)
)
```

### Line chart

```{r}
(
  p <- penguins %>%
    remove_missing() %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = flipper_length_mm,
               color = species)) +
    geom_line() +
    facet_wrap(vars(species, sex), nrow = 3)
)
```

### Bar chart

- per default: counts

```{r}
(
  p <- penguins %>%
    remove_missing() %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = species,
               fill = sex)) +
    geom_bar()
)
```

```{r}
(
  p <- penguins %>%
    remove_missing() %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = species,
               fill = sex)) +
    geom_bar(position = 'dodge')
)
```

- alternative: set y-values

```{r}
(
  p <- penguins %>%
    remove_missing() %>%
    group_by(species, sex) %>%
    summarise(mean_bmg = mean(body_mass_g)) %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = species, y = mean_bmg,
               fill = sex)) +
    geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge")
)
```

### Boxplot

```{r}
(
  p <- penguins %>%
    remove_missing() %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = species, y = body_mass_g,
               fill = sex)) +
    geom_boxplot()
)
```

### Pie chart

```{r}
(
  p <- penguins %>%
    remove_missing() %>%
    group_by(species, sex) %>%
    summarise(n = n()) %>%
    mutate(freq = n / sum(n),
           percentage = freq * 100) %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = "", y = percentage,
               fill = sex)) +
    facet_wrap(vars(species), nrow = 1) +
    geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
    coord_polar("y", start=0)
)
```
